private_information: I can manipulate only vowel-labelled blocks: A, E, I.
I may move only the top block of any stack and only one block at a time.
vowel_agent.goal: Help reconfigure the blocks from the initial stacks to the target single stack where A is on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, and J is on the table.

private_information: I can manipulate only consonant-labelled blocks: B, C, D, F, G, H, J.
I may move only the top block of any stack and only one block at a time.
consonant_agent.goal: Help reconfigure the blocks from the initial stacks to the target single stack where A is on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, and J is on the table.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and must integrate their local knowledge into a final PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a combined PDDL domain and PDDL problem that achieves the global stacking goal while keeping the agents' action sets distinct and respecting their manipulation constraints.

public_information: There are 10 uniquely labelled blocks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J.
Blocks are arranged into stacks on a table. Only the top block of a stack may be moved at any time and only one block can be moved per action.
One agent may only manipulate vowel blocks (A, E, I) and the other may only manipulate consonant blocks (B, C, D, F, G, H, J).
Initial stacks are: stack1 bottom-to-top C, F, H, J and stack2 bottom-to-top B, G, E, A, I, D.
The target is a single stack bottom-to-top J, I, H, G, F, E, D, C, B, A, i.e., J on the table and each subsequent letter on the previous one.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an agent responsible for vowel blocks. Provide clear observations, the set of primitive actions you can perform on the world with preconditions and effects described in plain language, and a local sequence of moves (a local plan) that respects your manipulation constraints. Do not emit PDDL; produce structured, plain-text descriptions that the orchestrator can use to assemble the final PDDL.
pddl.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. Public environment facts: There are 10 blocks A-J; only top blocks can be moved; initial stacks are stack1: C-F-H-J and stack2: B-G-E-A-I-D; your private knowledge: you can move only vowels A, E, I and only top blocks one at a time. Describe which stacks have vowel blocks on top that you can move, list your available primitive actions with preconditions and effects in plain language, and provide a stepwise local plan you could execute to help reach the global goal given only your knowledge. If you lack information about where a consonant block must finally be placed, describe the constraints you need rather than making assumptions.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an agent responsible for consonant blocks. Provide clear observations, the set of primitive actions you can perform on the world with preconditions and effects described in plain language, and a local sequence of moves (a local plan) that respects your manipulation constraints. Do not emit PDDL; produce structured, plain-text descriptions that the orchestrator can use to assemble the final PDDL.
pddl.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. Public environment facts: There are 10 blocks A-J; only top blocks can be moved; initial stacks are stack1: C-F-H-J and stack2: B-G-E-A-I-D; your private knowledge: you can move only consonants B, C, D, F, G, H, J and only top blocks one at a time. Describe which stacks have consonant blocks on top that you can move, list your available primitive actions with preconditions and effects in plain language, and provide a stepwise local plan you could execute to help reach the global goal given only your knowledge. If you lack information about vowel placement requirements, describe the constraints you need rather than making assumptions.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the two agents' plain-text observations, action descriptions, and local plans to produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards planner. Keep the action schemas for the two agents distinct in the domain (prefix or annotate actions to indicate vowel or consonant agent where appropriate). The domain must include types, predicates, actions with preconditions and effects, and any necessary constraints to enforce that vowels can only be moved by the vowel agent and consonants only by the consonant agent. The problem must encode the initial stacks and the global goal stack. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Make explicit any assumptions you make during integration.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the vowel agent's output and the consonant agent's output. Integrate their observations and local action descriptions into a single coherent PDDL domain and a PDDL problem compatible with FastDownwards. Ensure actions remain distinct per agent and that the final PDDL models the initial stacks and the target single stack where J is on the table and A is on top of B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, and I on J. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. State any integration assumptions in a short note inside the problem file as comments if needed.
